intro: Tagetes jaliscensis, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, daisy-like flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. Tagetes jaliscensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
